item.title: New Zealand knocks Sri Lanka out of Twenty20 World Cup in super eight match in Colombo
item.description: New Zealand knocks tournament co-hosts Sri Lanka out of the Twenty20 World Cup with a 61-run win in their super eights game in Colombo.

item.title: Expanded Newcastle Art Gallery finally opens after decades of turmoil
item.description: It has been two decades in the making, but the troubled Newcastle Art Gallery expansion is finally opening its doors.

item.title: Guide to Listening: ABC Classic's Festival of Female Composers and International Women's Day on ABC Jazz
item.description: For 10 years, in the lead-up to International Women's Day, ABC Classic has celebrated classical music by women across centuries. Here's what's in store for 2026.

item.title: Prosecutor's breach of WA evidence rules triggers retrial for man accused of child sex offences
item.description: A man found guilty of sexually abusing his stepdaughters wins a retrial because a "serious breach" by a prosecutor resulted in a "miscarriage of justice".

item.title: Gary Foley Collection tells activism history through Aboriginal lens
item.description: The ABC gets a rare look at the Aboriginal History Archive, a little-known collection of thousands of items collected by the well-known activist Gary Foley.

item.title: Australians fear falling victim to AI-related crimes, deepfakes and hacks, research shows
item.description: More than half of Australian adults are worried about AI being used to cause them harm, and almost as many fear falling victim to a crime enabled by the technology, a report found.

item.title: What is Shen Yun, the group named in a threat against Prime Minister Anthony Albanese?
item.description: Police are investigating a bomb threat against a Gold Coast theatre hosting a classical Chinese dance group after a threat was also made against the prime minister's official residence.

item.title: Dolphin injured in suspected boat strike
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Mardi Gras is almost here. How well do you know Australian LGBTQIA+ history?
item.description: Australia's LGBTQIA+ history is full to the brim with groundbreaking art, brave protests and lots of fun along the way. Test how much you know about the queer trailblazers of our country in this quiz.

item.title: Cuba says boat from Florida opened fire at its soldiers, starting fight that killed 4
item.description: Cuban forces killed four people and wounded six others aboard a Florida-based speedboat that entered Cuban waters and opened fire on a Cuban patrol, the country's government says.

item.title: US tariffs on Australia remain at 10 per cent — for now
item.description: Trade Minister Don Farrell hopes Australia can dodge a higher tariff rate being imposed by the US, saying trade officials overnight confirmed the tariff rate on Australia would remain at 10 per cent — at least for now.

item.title: New Shanghai Chinese restaurant in Katherine rocked by pre-dawn machete attack, carjacking
item.description: A Top End Chinese restaurant manager says the eatery's staff have left town after its chef was allegedly threatened with a knife in a pre-dawn carjacking.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup 2026: Philippines up for the fight against the Matildas in tournament opener
item.description: The last time the Filipinas faced Australia they were trounced 8-0. But they have a renewed side and spirit, and are ready to push the Matildas all the way in the first Women's Asian Cup game in Perth.

item.title: RBA governor Michele Bullock calls for patience as rate decisions get harder
item.description: Michelle Bullock gives more details on how quickly developments affecting monetary policy have moved since the middle of last year.

item.title: Teenager Jeremy Webb died of meat allergy from tick bites, coroner finds
item.description: Teenager Jeremy Webb's death in 2022 is the first documented fatal case of mammalian meat allergy in the country and second in the world.

item.title: Former Australian of the Year Grace Tame responds to Anthony Albanese's 'difficult life' apology
item.description: Grace Tame criticises Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's qualified apology after he described her as "difficult", saying "what a patronising cop-out".

item.title: INXS nominated for induction into Rock & Roll Hall of Fame
item.description: INXS will be considered for induction into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame and is one of 10 first-time nominees on the ballot.

item.title: Gas giant Arrow Energy takes Australia's biggest pork producer to court over gas pipelines
item.description: A major energy company is taking Australia's largest pork producer to court over plans to build gas pipelines through its property on Queensland's Western Downs.

item.title: The AFL's ruck rule changes spark fears of an injury influx as Shannon Neale limps off in preseason
item.description: Geelong's Shannon Neale might have escaped a serious injury, but coaches and players are beginning to voice concerns the AFL's rule changes could lead to more rucks getting hurt.

item.title: Sunset Strip residents learn water unsafe even for washing in after 66 years using it to brush teeth
item.description: Residents in Sunset Strip knew their water was not safe to drink, but it came as a great shock to read a letter stating it was not safe to bathe in or wash with either.

item.title: Former patient of gynaecologist Simon Gordon, Sarah Hayden speaks out about her treatment.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Hundreds of former patients of gynaecologist Simon Gordon join support group
item.description: More former patients of Melbourne gynaecologist Simon Gordon have come forward to express distress over their treatment with many joining a newly-formed private support group.

item.title: Senator Sarah Hanson-Young calls for Triple Zero overhaul at Optus outage hearing
item.description: A Senate committee hears bombshell testimony about Optus's processes during an outage that led to the deaths of multiple customers who were unable to call Triple Zero.

item.title: Debate about children of 'ISIS brides' has become hyper-politicised
item.description: The fate of the "ISIS brides" is inextricably linked to constitutional facts but the debate about their future is not taking place in a legal chamber — it is being fought in the court of public opinion.

item.title: Qantas shares fall more than 6 per cent after first-half profit announced
item.description: Qantas' first-half profit result has disappointed shareholders, but chief executive Vanessa Hudson says the airline's largest fleet renewal in history will pay off.

item.title: What is mammalian meat allergy and how do you develop it?
item.description: Jeremy Webb's death in 2022 from a tick-induced red meat allergy is the first to be recorded in Australia. Here's what we know about mammalian meat allergy and how to avoid it.

item.title: Coral colony discovered by mother and daughter citizen scientists could be world's largest
item.description: Mother and daughter citizen scientists find what is believed to be the largest coral colony on the Great Barrier Reef and possibly in the world.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: How an onstage clash between a future NT administrator and a political hopeful drew battle lines
item.description: A keynote speaker shoved an environmental activist at a conference in 2023. Now, one of them is the Northern Territory's next administrator.

item.title: High levels of E. coli and dead fish found in River Torrens, causing a stink
item.description: Rowers have had to move their training and a boat operator has held off bookings after high levels of E. coli were detected alongside dead fish on a stretch of the River Torrens in Adelaide.

item.title: Abattoir Beaufort River Meats halts operations as $20m in live export transition grants are rolled out
item.description: Forty farming families and five processors have secured live sheep transition funding from more than 260 applicants, including Beaufort River Meats in the Great Southern, which has temporarily shut down amid ongoing livestock shortages.

item.title: Cuba claims 'armed terrorist infiltration' prevented during open water speedboat shootout
item.description: Cuban coastguard troops shot dead four people and injured six others they claimed were approaching the country on a speedboat filled with weapons set to be used in an act of terror.

item.title: Albanese's week unravelled by one-word description of Grace Tame
item.description: The prime minister was this week evacuated from the Lodge over a bomb threat and later got stuck in a tit-for-tat with a former Australian of the Year.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Dingo advocates call for end to culls and recognition of environmental and cultural value
item.description: A campaign to introduce protections to native dingoes has taken its fight to parliament house, arguing that treating dingoes as pests is causing deep cultural and environmental harm.

item.title: Winegrape growers welcome the establishment of national vineyard register
item.description: Grape growers have endured a tough few years and there are hopes that a national database will help to improve the industry's fortunes.

item.title: Sharp decline in tobacco sales linked to illegal sales, not people quitting, says researcher
item.description: Business managers and researchers are concerned that a sharp decline in tobacco sales in Alice Springs could mean more people are taking up smoking illegal tobacco.

item.title: Fungal infection cluster at Royal Prince Alfred Hospital linked to deaths of two patients
item.description: The cluster of infections at the transplant unit at the Royal Prince Alfred Hospital late last year saw two people die, health bosses say.

item.title: NT cattle stations assess flood damage, as rain in central Australia declared natural disaster
item.description: Disaster recovery funding is activated by the NT and federal governments, as flood-affected communities begin counting the cost.

item.title: SPC Global scales back plans for Shepparton juice production move with Fair Dinkum deal
item.description: SPC Global is moving juice production away from Melbourne in a bid to save $8 million a year.

item.title: Australia to focus on basics against India in second match of ODI series
item.description: Ash Gardner says mastering a simple game plan was the key to Australia's convincing six-wicket win over India in the ODI series opener Brisbane.

item.title: Former teacher Stephen Fane Noga denies allegations by former student they had sex while she was his student
item.description: Stephen Fane Noga has denied allegations he had sex with a former student while he was one of her teachers at Hobart Matriculation College in the 1980s.

item.title: Thursday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: What is the future for Tennis Australia?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Funding axe looms for nine childcare centres failing standards
item.description: Nine childcare services that have failed to lift standards will only be named if the federal government decides to cut their taxpayer funding.

item.title: Health, environment departments questioned 'evidence' cited in salmon antibiotic approval for florfenicol in Tasmanian waterways
item.description: Tasmania's health department and environment watchdog questioned the scientific rigour behind an application to use the antibiotic florfenicol in salmon farms, including a lack of evidence about its impact on humans, documents show.

item.title: Gold Coast couple accused of breaching freezing orders a second time amid alleged NDIS fraud investigation
item.description: It is the second time ASIC has accused David McWilliams and his wife, Laura Fullarton, of breaching freezing orders while the watchdog investigates allegations of NDIS-related fraud.

item.title: From A$AP Rocky to Megadeth — these 10 great albums got 2026 started right
item.description: This year has already given us a bounty of beautiful new records. Here are just 10 of the best we've heard so far.

item.title: What is the best wash cycle to use on your washing machine?
item.description: Eco, fast, cotton, heavy, intense cold? Experts on the most cost-effective and efficient wash cycles for your home.

item.title: How Australia's lax property tax has created a class system
item.description: Australian real estate now is among the world's most expensive, and that has made it a red-hot political issue as demographics shift.

item.title: Thousands break into property market with 5% Deposit Scheme for first home buyers
item.description: The number of people buying their first home with a 5 per cent deposit surges after the federal government makes sweeping changes to the scheme.

item.title: Myanmar military using festivals as propaganda to hide war zone
item.description: As Myanmar's junta celebrates Chin National Day in an effort to project control, air strikes on civilians underscore a deepening civil war.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup 2026: 'Proactive' Matildas aiming for Asian Cup glory under Joe Montemurro
item.description: Although filled with familiar faces, the Matildas are now a completely different side to the one that captured hearts and minds at the 2023 World Cup. This is how a "proactive" Australian side is likely to line up at the Women's Asian Cup.

item.description: The number of Indigenous people behind bars is rising. But some judges are bucking the trend by taking a different approach.

item.description: The dispute between HungryPanda and some of its riders has taken another twist, with the food delivery company accusing some workers of intimidation and blackmail.

item.title: Hillary Clinton slams Epstein committee for grilling her instead of Donald Trump
item.description: Hillary Clinton blasts a Republican-led congressional committee for summoning her to answer questions about Jeffrey Epstein while failing to push US President Donald Trump to do the same thing.

item.description: South Australia's embattled Liberals have openly declared their willingness to strike a preference deal with One Nation. Will it help or hurt them on election day?

item.title: India beats Zimbabwe, South Africa beats West Indies at T20 World Cup as Proteas reach semifinals
item.description: The final four at the Twenty20 World Cup is taking shape after South Africa progressed on the back of a victory over West Indies, and India's victory over Zimbabwe.

item.description: Global powerhouse Bad Bunny is bringing together Sydney’s Latin diaspora and exciting fans who cannot speak a word of Spanish.

item.description: Analysts say a share market correction is 'likely' as the ASX hits record high.

item.title: Amy Sayer eager to represent Matildas at Asian Cup after long-term knee injury
item.description: After a long-term injury seriously derailed her career, Australian soccer player Amy Sayer is looking to leave a mark on this year's Asian Cup, which begins for the Matildas on Sunday in Perth.

item.title: Seismologists investigate 'mysterious' earthquake swarm near Gnowangerup in southern WA
item.description: After a dozen earthquakes in a single day and more than 70 over the course of February, farmers in Gnowangerup are curious about what is rumbling their paddocks.

item.description: Dozens of people are charged after a raid in central Queensland seized more than $3 million worth of drugs from what people say was a "deeply entrenched drug syndicate".

item.description: A government source said it would make sense to consider changes to negative gearing and capital gains tax together, but that no decision was close to being made.

item.description: A protester has been arrested amid chaotic scenes outside of NT Parliament, where David Connolly has been sworn in as the new administrator.

item.description: Mass graves with at least 171 dead bodies have been found in the eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo, in a region the M23 rebel group has recently withdrawn from.

item.description: Michael Henry's armour and weapons survived January's bushfires, as the Swordcraft community helps him rise from the ashes.

item.description: Many people are struggling with the cost of living and increasingly, young Australians say they are not just worried about the situation now, but also what it means for the future.

item.description: As they advanced in age without a child to carry on the line, many expected the Akuntsu to vanish when the three remaining women died.

item.description: Georgia Voll strikes her second ODI century after being dropped on 99, as Australia cruises to a five-wicket win over India and takes a 6-4 lead in the multi-format series.

item.title: Deluge for SA and Victoria while Queensland, NT and WA eye triple cyclone threat

item.description: As gunshots rang out at Bondi, dozens of eyewitnesses risked their lives to film the horror. This is what they wanted you to see.

item.title: Former prince Andrew's scandals pose an almighty challenge for Prince William
item.description: When Prince William and Princess Catherine stepped out for their first public appearance since Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's arrest, an innocuous question was levelled at them. The candid response was perhaps more revealing than anticipated.

item.description: A community battery project three years in the making, run by a local not-for-profit and backed by the council, was killed after a spark of misinformation about its fire risk was ignited.

item.description: Landholders opposed to VNI West have been given 30 days to allow environmental assessments before authorised officers can enter by force.

item.title: US Republicans call for Australian lamb investigation as new bill proposes 30pc tariff
item.description: Republicans write to Donald Trump's top trade officials to request an investigation into Australian lamb, as several members of Congress sponsor a bill for a 30 per cent tariff on Australian sheep products.

item.title: Australian Antarctic team yields big haul of fresh produce with hydroponics
item.description: Antarctica is the coldest, driest and windiest continent on the planet. But at Casey Station, Australian expeditioners have grown 130 kilos of fresh produce in a year thanks to a hydroponics facility.

item.description: Flooded communities in outback Queensland are set for some relief, with the Bureau of Meteorology expecting heavy rain to ease over the weekend.

item.title: Launceston City Council reveals $13 million increase for Princess Theatre, Earl Arts Centre upgrade
item.description: The Launceston City Council has revealed the redevelopment of a historic theatre and arts centre will cost almost 50 per cent more than expected, but the mayor insists it is "not a cost blowout".

item.title: Doctor claims 'eleventh hour' condition on state election promise could tank Launceston hospital plans
item.description: Medical experts fear a recently revealed condition on a Tasmanian election promise could kill a new hospital proposal, amid escalating concern about health facilities.

item.title: Deniliquin mother creates sensory cape to support neurodivergent kids
item.description: Lucy Horne has spent years perfecting a "sensory suit" to help her autistic son with overwhelming situations like going to the hairdresser, and now she wants to share it.

item.title: Can tax reform fix Australia's housing crisis? | Insiders: On Background
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Tram derails in central Milan leaving two dead
item.description: A tram derails in the heart of Milan close to the city's Central Station, killing two people and injuring around 40 others.

item.title: Aboriginal community, linguists revive ancient Ngaiawang language of River Murray
item.description: Ngaiawang language, once spoken frequently along the sweeping bend of the River Murray or the Rinta, was almost wiped out by colonisation.

item.title: Quick and easy green ginger and miso noodles made from pantry staples - ABC News
item.description: Close the delivery app and get through some kitchen staples with this easy spinach, ginger and miso noodle recipe.

item.title: Safety warning to Victorian farmers after four work deaths in two months
item.description: The recent death of a respected Victorian dairy farmer has prompted fresh warnings about workplace dangers in the agricultural sector.

item.title: Neil Sedaka, singer of Breaking Up Is Hard To Do, dies aged 86
item.description: Neil Sedaka, the American singer and songwriter who sold millions of records worldwide, dies aged 86.

item.title: How the 'amazing' Pretzel will help Scott march in Sydney's iconic Mardi Gras parade
item.description: When Scott Dixon-Smith started his career, his workplace accommodated his blindness but not his sexuality. Tonight, he will march in the pride parade with the help of his guide dog, Pretzel.

item.title: Regional mobile phone users lament lost service as complaints spike
item.description: As reliability complaints increase, regional customers say mobile phone service is declining.

item.title: Bolivian plane carrying banknotes crashes, leaving 20 people dead
item.description: A Bolivian Air Force Hercules aircraft carrying new banknotes crashes into a busy avenue, leaving 20 people dead and around 30 more injured.

item.title: US President Trump orders six-month phase-out of Anthropic AI technology across government
item.description: The Trump administration has ordered all US agencies to stop using Anthropic's artificial intelligence technology and imposed other major penalties, culminating an unusually public clash between the government and the company over AI safeguards.

item.title: Australian documentary Floodland uncovers human toll of 2022 Lismore floods
item.description: Four years after floodwaters peaked at 14.4 metres in Lismore, a new documentary looks at how the town moved forward — and what more needs to be done.

item.title: Calls for SA election commitment to maintain feral deer eradication funding
item.description: More than 28,000 feral deer have been eradicated in South Australia since a program began in 2022, but conservationists say it needs a long-term funding commitment to finish the job.

item.title: What a Paramount-owned Warner Bros Discovery means for the movies
item.description: The proposed takeover of Warner Bros by Paramount could reshape Hollywood, movie theatres and the wider media landscape.

item.title: Facing threats of war, Denmark turns to a new weapon: women
item.description: Denmark is fast-tracking female conscription as it muscles up to Russia and faces threats of invasion from the US.

item.title: Bolivian military plane crash kills 15
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: NASA shakes up Moon program with new test mission before astronaut lunar landing
item.description: NASA shakes up its Artemis Moon exploration program, adding an extra practice flight before a crewed lunar landing planned for two years' time.

item.title: Peter V'landys confirms NRL's intentions to expand internationally beyond Las Vegas
item.description: After experiencing tremendous success in Las Vegas, Peter V'landys is planning to take the NRL to other major cities around the world.

item.title: FIFO workers keep football leagues alive in Pilbara towns with transient populations
item.description: Local football leagues depend on FIFO workers to boost player numbers in remote and regional WA, and the workers say getting involved makes being away from home a little more enjoyable.

item.title: Australia's almond industry cracks $1.3 billion mark as Chinese demand rises
item.description: Australian almonds are breaking records as the trade war between the United States and China rolls on.

item.title: Tiny Victorian photo album provides snapshot of a bygone era
item.description: While wealthy upper-class colonial families were sitting for expensive studio portraits in the 1880s, many with less money were collecting miniature portraits in tiny photo albums like this one.

item.title: Liberals launch Nepean candidate's campaign ahead of by-election challenge from One Nation
item.description: The Liberal Party launches the campaign for candidate Anthony Marsh in the Nepean by-election, following the departure of Sam Groth.

item.title: Pride in Protest float excluded from Sydney Mardi Gras over 'offensive' comments about Jewish LGBTQ group
item.description: Mardi Gras organisers have issued a formal warning to Pride in Protest on Friday morning, stating they had breached the parade's terms and conditions.

item.title: Gorillaz album The Mountain exorcises death with Indian music greats
item.description: Damon Albarn and Jamie Hewlett discuss how trips to India, grieving and A-list collaborations shaped the latest genre-defying Gorillaz album, The Mountain.

item.title: Professor MaryAnn Bin-Sallik remembered as a 'trailblazer' in Aboriginal education, health and rights
item.description: MaryAnn Bin-Sallik was the first Aboriginal nurse graduate in Darwin and the first Aboriginal person to receive a PhD at Harvard University. Following her death at age 85, the Djaru Elder is being remembered for her work in Indigenous education, health and human rights.

item.title: Lorraine Bayly, former Play School host and star of The Sullivans, dies aged 89
item.description: Lorraine Bayly, star of long-running soap opera The Sullivans and a former Play School host, has died aged 89, after years of ill health.

item.title: Terror charges against Liam Hall and Jayson Michaels reveal challenge of maintaining social cohesion
item.description: The charging of two young West Australian men with terror offences show the challenges facing social cohesion, and solving the problem is not going to be easy.

item.title: Terror police investigate disturbance, white powder at Perth Mosque
item.description: Terrorism police in Perth investigate a disturbance outside a Perth mosque overnight and the discovery of a "non-suspicious substance" on the footpath outside.

item.title: Triple Melbourne Cup winner Makybe Diva dead at 27 after sudden health battle
item.description: The champion racehorse who rose to fame after combining with Glen Boss for three-straight Melbourne Cup wins has died.

item.title: Cheaper, easier and less taboo: Why more gen Zs are getting cosmetic injectables such as botox
item.description: The number of non-surgical cosmetic procedures such as botox has increased by more than 44 per cent worldwide in four years. What's driving the increase?

item.title: SA Liberal and Labor to preference David Speirs last at state election
item.description: Both major parties in South Australia say they will preference former opposition leader David Speirs last at the state election, as he rules out returning to the Liberal Party.

item.title: Trump says US has launched 'major operation' against Iran, with Israel calling 'pre-emptive' attack a joint effort
item.description: US-Israeli strikes on Iran have prompted a string of retaliatory attacks and travel chaos across the region.

item.title: Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade draws thousands with politics at forefront
item.description: Glitter, sequins and political statements have been at the centre of Sydney's Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade along Oxford Street.

item.title: Explosions across Middle East as Iranian retaliation puts Israel on alert — as it happened
item.description: Israel and the US have attacked Iran, with a swift response from Tehran threatening to widen the conflict across the Middle East. Follow live.

item.title: Sam Kerr admits to doubts surrounding injury issues ahead of Matildas Asian Cup campaign
item.description: Sam Kerr says she is still not at 100 per cent as she details her moments of self-doubt during her return to Matildas colours.

item.title: Power disrupted at Flinders Medical Centre during Adelaide's morning storm
item.description: A temporary power disruption has impacted surgery capacity at one of Adelaide's largest hospitals as parts of the state received record rainfall.

item.title: Israel and US attack Iran, sparking retaliatory strikes. Here's what we know
item.description: After weeks of anticipation, Israel fired the first shot on Iran, drawing in the US and sparking retaliatory strikes that have hit several countries.

item.title: Albanese says Australian government 'supports US acting to prevent Iran obtaining a nuclear weapon'
item.description: Anthony Albanese says the international community has been clear that the Iranian regime can never be allowed to develop a nuclear weapon".

item.title: This US-Israeli strike on Iran is different and could lead to a longer, deadlier war
item.description: It was clear within hours that this conflict is different and threatens to engulf the region in a longer, deadlier war.

item.title: Travellers stranded as US-Iran conflict throws international flights into chaos
item.description: Among nations closing their airspace and suspending flights are major international transit hubs connecting Australian travellers with Europe and Asia.

item.title: Live: Netanyahu says there are 'many signs' Iran's supreme leader 'is gone'
item.description: Benjamin Netanyahu says the compound of Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was destroyed and "there are many signs that this dictator is gone". Follow live.

item.title: Astrology vs the algorithm: Why my Indian parents are hunting for my husband
item.description: From Tinder-style apps to astrological birth charts — how today's arranged marriages blend tech and tradition in unexpected ways.

item.title: Punch the monkey reminds us 'we all need soft spaces'
item.description: There's surely a reason we all went briefly nuts about a lonely little snow monkey called Punch living in a Japanese zoo.

item.title: Hard Quiz: Get ready trivia nuts. It's time to play, HARD!
item.description: Have you been waiting all week to give this quiz another crack? You should probably find a hobby.

item.title: Arrested Development's long love affair with Australia continues with a trip to WOMADelaide
item.description: The pioneering hip hop group returns to Australia this week, with big ideas about the future of hip hop.

item.title: Cheat Sheet: Weinstein, Gaza boycotts, dead bodies and 30 years of Scream
item.description: Weinstein, copycat panic, leaked scripts, closed studios and departing stars — Scream's 30-year journey has been anything but smooth and the seventh edition in the cornerstone slasher series is no different.

item.title: Women trafficked, kids taught to shoot in PNG's tribal warfare industry
item.description: The proliferation of illegal high-powered guns is fuelling tribal warfare across Papua New Guinea and warlords claim children as young as eight are being trained to carry the weapons.

item.title: Former NSW prison officers say system protects abusers and silences women
item.description: Current and former NSW prison officers describe what they say is a toxic workplace culture and a system that shields officers accused of serious misconduct, rather than holding them accountable. They argue it has driven younger officers out of the service.

item.title: Seventh narco sub discovered in the Pacific as Australia's cocaine habit drives heavy traffic
item.description: At least seven narco subs have been discovered in Pacific waters near Australia over the past 18 months, with experts warning that Australia's cocaine demand means more are on the way.

item.title: NSW unveils sweeping foster care reforms for thousands of vulnerable children
item.description: While some child protection services will continue to be outsourced, the NSW government will play a larger role in the sector, including through the recruitment of foster carers.

item.title: Meet the mapmakers recording every remote road in Australia to keep travellers safer
item.description: Google Maps has made city driving a dream, but it's putting lives at risk in the bush. Meet the mapmakers taking on Australia's roughest roads to try to change that.

item.title: Medical Board of Australia to appeal decision allowing Dr Dileepa Jayaweera to continue working at Ballarat clinic
item.description: The Medical Board of Australia is appealing a tribunal decision that allowed a Ballarat doctor accused of digitally penetrating a female patient to continue working at the same clinic.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup hopes to change women's football in Australia — again
item.description: The Matildas' run in the 2023 World Cup saw unprecedented media coverage and crowds, and a participation boom among girls and women. Can the Asian Cup do the same?

item.title: Tehran retaliates across Middle East after US and Israel launch strikes aimed at regime change
item.description: Bahrain, Qatar, Jordan and Israel were targeted by Iran after Donald Trump said the strikes were aimed at regime change.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup 2026: What time do the Matildas play? How to watch and follow Australia vs the Philippines
item.description: The Women's Asian Cup is finally upon us, with the Matildas beginning their quest for a second continental crown against the Philippines in Perth. This is all the need to know information, plus how to watch and follow the tournament opener.

item.title: Domestic violence accounts for 40pc of the more than 200 kidnappings that take place annually in NSW
item.description: Data shows that in the year to September 2025, NSW Police received 230 abduction and kidnapping reports — up from 224 in the previous year.

item.title: Minjee Lee and Hannah Green set for all-Aussie shootout in Women's World Championship final round
item.description: Australian duo Minjee Lee and Hannah Green share a one-shot lead in Singapore with 18 holes of the Women's World Championship to play.

item.title: Growing expectations Lake Eyre could reach full capacity for first time in decades
item.description: In the centre of Australia, there are whispers that Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre is experiencing conditions strangely similar to those that set a record depth of 6 metres in 1974.

item.title: Extreme rhetoric in Australia's right-wing political circles deserves more attention
item.description: The rhetoric in Australia's right-wing political circles is getting more extreme and the media should be paying more attention.
